feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 11:44AM AKST until November 18 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Rain, freezing rain, and snow is occurring. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills. Freezing rain
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKST FRIDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect until 2 PM AKST Friday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert. &&

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 18 at 9:15AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to continue a slow fall through Moderate Flood stage into next week. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 18 at 9:14AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at DeLand is forecast to remain within Moderate Flood Stage while slowly falling to near Minor Flood Stage this weekend. Residents and interests along the river should expect a continuation of moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 18 at 9:13AM EST until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 12:30PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLOWING SNOW AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES.. Brief periods of snow and blowing snow this afternoon will affect areas around Langdon to Cavalier and western Walsh and northern Ramsey Counties. Persons and vehicles across this area can expect conditions to deteriorate to poor visibility for brief periods of time. These conditions will continue through sunset.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 9:49PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Light snow possible across the Big Country... Light snow will be possible Friday night, mainly along and just south of Interstate 20. Accumulations will be very light and will be mainly on vegetation and elevated surfaces. This could result in some slick spots on bridges and overpasses. Please use caution if you are driving Friday evening into Saturday morning. Precipitation

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 1:41PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BRIEF MODERATE SNOW SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON... Scattered snow showers are expected to move across central and east-central Wisconsin this afternoon. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 4:03PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SNOW SHOWER WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND...SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...FAYETTE...MONONGALIA...PRESTON AND MARION COUNTIES... At 402 PM EST, a snow shower was located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Seven Springs to near Fairview. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this snow shower.
